title: Blackstone to Invest $1 Billion in Music Rights
sub_head: Asset manager says investment would benefit from rapid growth of online streaming
body:
Blackstone Inc. plans to invest $1 billion in acquiring music rights and managing catalogs, a move the asset manager said will benefit from the rapid growth of online streaming.
The investment will come as part of a partnership with an advisory firm affiliated with Hipgnosis Songs Fund Ltd. , a music-investment company that trades on the London Stock Exchange. Hipgnosis, led by former pop-star manager Merck Mercuriadis, buys artistsâ€™ song catalogs and earns revenue when the music is streamed online or used in movies or advertising.
